item.title: Apple Extended Keyboard II
item.description: History Apple manufactured this board in the late ’80s and early 90s. This board was the successor of the venerable Apple Extended Keyboard. These boards were included with Apple professional desktops starting with the Macintosh IIsi. These boards use either Alps or Mitsumi switches. The Mitsumi switches were only used on boards made in Japan. M3501s are said to be the last “Mechanical Keyboards” that apple has ever made. Apple Extended Keyboard II back Build and features I got this German layout M3501 from the Deskthority sale listing for a fair price.
